reviewText: If you can get past the fact that Carol Burnett is only a supporting cast member here, these episodes are delightful. Wonderful Christmas episodes from an earlier age. Great guests appearing  with a talented cast. I'm enjoying the heck out of my copy of these old shows. Enjoy it for what it is and I doubt you'll be sorry.

reviewText: The packaging advertising is deceptive.  When you get the DVD package it states A CAROL BURNETT CHRISTMAS, and  in tiny lettering above The Garry Moore Show Presents.  To be totally honest that should have been made clear from the beginning when advertising this on Amazon.  And rather than a 1970's color photo of Carol, a late 50's, early 60's photo should have been used.  Now as for content, the episodes are actually pretty entertaining IF you like that era of TV variety shows.  "The Garry Moore Show" helped launch Carol Burnett and these Christmas episodes (particularly the third one featuring Julie Andrews) are good.  Along with Carol as an ensemble member of Garry ('I've Got a Secret')Moore's cast you have Durwood Kirby and Marion ('Aunt Clara' from Bewitched) Lorne as well as the Garry Moore Show singers and dancers.  If you are looking for wall to wall Carol Burnett you won't find her here.  She is featured, to be sure, thru-out but there is a lot of content not involving Carol Burnett.  However, if you enjoy long-a-go Christmas variety shows/specials and enjoy the work of some of the performers included on this DVD, as I do, then you might enjoy this.EPISODE ONE: CHRISTMAS, 1959(Guests:  Eddie Hodges, Charlie Weaver & Mahalia Jackson & ensemble cast of Durwood Kirby, Marion Lorne & Carol Burnett)Garry Moore Entrance/Introduction of GuestsSales Clerk skitTo Tell the Truth skitBanter between Garry & Charlie Weaver"I'm in Love With Ms. Logan"--Song by Eddie HodgesCandid Camera interlude with Alan FuntShow presented with Award"Holy Baby"--Song by Mahalia JacksonThe Christmas Card game (where cast including Carol try to figure out what celebrity sent a Christmas card)Dance Routine (by the Garry Moore Show dancers)"Silent Night" --sung by Mahalia JacksonGarry sends Merry Christmas wishes to all"We Wish you a Merry Christmas"--sung by entire cast(This show is fun and the three songs by Mahalia Jackson are sung beautifully)EPISODE TWO: CHRISTMAS 1960:(Guests:  Louise O'Brien & Jonathan Winters with ensemble: Durwood Kirby, Marion Lorne, Carol Burnett & The Garry Moore Show Singers & Dancers)Garry Moore Entrance & Introductions of Guests and Ensemble"Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas", sung by Louise O'BrienGarry Moore, Marion Lorne & Louise O'Brien skitJonathan Winters skit as 'Grandma Hopps'Carolers skitPost Office Skit (featuring Garry playing Buster Keaton)That Wonderful YearDriving SkitEnsemble christmas medley"Silent Night", sung by Louise O'BrienGary Wishes one and all a Merry ChristmasEPISODE THREE: CHRISTMAS 1961:(Guests: Julie Andrews & Gwen Verdon with ensemble: Durwood Kirby, Marion Lorne, Carol Burnett & The Garry Moore Show Singers and Dancers):Garry Moore Entrance & Introductions of Guests and EnsembleGarry Moore MonologueGwen Verdon/Ensemble dancers Dance numberMarion Lorne fur coat ski"My Favorite Things", sung by Julie AndrewsPhysical Fitness skit/song & dance with Carol, Julie & GwenThat Wonderful Year"Little Drummer Boy," Ensemble Singers"You Meet the Nicest People," Ensemble Singers"Jingle Bells" sung in Spanish"The First Noel" sung in French by Gwen Verdon"Deck the Halls" sung by Marion Lorne"O' Christmas Tree" sung in German by Durwood Kirby"White Christmas" sung in Italian by Julie AndrewsChristmas in Mexico (clips)Ensemble cast of Garry, Durwood, Carol & Marion recall Christmas performances from the past"Silent Night" sung by Julie AndrewsGarry extends Christmas wishes, "We Wish you a Merry Christmas"BONUS:Segments featuring Carol BurnettHoliday Song ModeClassic CommercialsSneak Previews
summary: A Carol Burnett Christmas--on the Garry Moore Show

reviewText: I honestly did not know what to do first.  I was either going to write this review so others know exactly what they are buying, OR, I was heading to the nearest Post Office to return this DVD to Amazon.  However, because I was thinking of the other Amazon customers first, especially all the fans of Carol Burnett, I decided to write my review of this DVD first, BEFORE I return it today.  I've surely purchased over 100 DVDs from Amazon over the past 5 years and I have never returned anything until today. These episodes are NOT, I repeat, these episodes NOT from the Carol Burnett show. These episodes are from the Garry Moore Show.  These episodes are from 1960 and 1961.  These episodes are ALL poorly filmed in Black and White. BLACK AND WHITE.  These episodes are all grainy. These episodes are NOT what I thought I was purchasing.  The artwork shown on Amazon's website is NOT the same as the artwork shown on the front of the DVD.  My last comment is:  BUYER BEWARE!  Now, I am on the way the Post Office to return this DVD
summary: Actually 3 BLACK AND WHITE episodes of the Garry Moore Show
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this because I am a fan of Carol Burnetts and Christmas Specials! If this was marketed with some truth it would have been fine with me. I still liked it because of the Christmas themed shows.But if you read the back cover ..something is not right!It says : SPECIAL HOLIDAY BONUS INSIDE THIS DVD CASE. Our legendary christmas card collection featuring 10 beautiful  designs by award-winning artist Chick Alcorn featuring rare photos of Carol Burnett from The Gary Moore Shows.No cards to be found. You get a page with a Code to go online and view the cards. Well..I just viewed the cards. It says COLLECT and SHARE. Even the photos weren't cleaned up. You can download them to your computer and print.The only BONUS features are three menus. One menu to view only the Carol segments on these bad quality shows. (I have some bootleg in better condition). Another menus to view only the Holiday segements and a menu to view the Old Commercials. All the products in the commercials are blurred so you cannot see what they are holding. Why have these on here then?The shows and audio are not restored as stated. I can imagine how the songs would sound on the CD if I had bought the $30 Collector's Edition.By viewing the trailer for this DVD release...with a one quick snippet of video...you will see why they wouldn't even show you what your buying.[...]If this was just listed honestly as the upcoming FIRST PERFORMANCESS Vol. 1 ( from The Garry Moore Show) it would be fine but the way they tried to jump on the Time/ Life recent release of The Carol Burnett Show DVD releases. Producing a color photo of Carol from The Carol Burnett Show and bogus Bonus Features, Holiday Cards and Restored image & sound quality just make me very careful to buy anything from this company LEGENDARY ENTERTAINMENT.I would have enjoyed this more if it was just honest about what is included. It will end up at Big Lot! for under $3.00 next Christmas...so best to hold off unless your a big Burnett fan or just love old TV shows.
summary: Should include a travel KY Gel...'cause you just got scrooged!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am returning this DVD because I was deceived into buying it, both by Amazon and the producer of the DVD.  The picture of the DVD shows a color version of Carol Burnett in a Santa hat beneath the banner, "A Carol Burnett Christmas."  All well and good and enticing.  But when I opened the package there is small print above the banner reading, "The Garry Moore Show presents"...The clips, good though they are, are in black-and-white, grainy, and replete with edited out visuals and vocals.True, Carol does appear, but this is NOT a Carol Burnett Christmas - she appears as she did (remarkably) on the Garry Moore Show.Shame on Amazon for deceiving loyal customers in this way.BEWARE!If you're a die-hard Carol fan, then go ahead and make this purchase...but if you're a die-hard fan of the fabulous Carol Burnett Show, run away.Fast.Disappointed by the deception.

reviewText: Well, I feel like a sucker. I bought this just assuming I was getting a few Carol Burnett Show Christmas Specials. IT IS NOT. I can't say I recall seeing "Gary Moore Show" on the description. As I recall, the description was vague...Hmmm...Oh well, lesson learned. No more buying pre orders on Amazon. Wait till other suckers buy them first and wait for the reviews(one of the great benefits of internet shopping). Not only is it not what I thought it was, it is also poor quality B&W; video from 1959 - 1961. Carol Burnett is only one of many others featured on this old show, The Gary Moore Show. Luckily this didn't cost much. I will still give it a watch(once) but I certainly feel like I was mislead and that takes some of the fun out of it.Okay, maybe it will be nice to see a young Carol Burnett but I say Bah Humbug, jerks!!!Update: I watched it and Carol Burnett is hardly even in this. She has a very minor role. To call this "A Carol Burnett Christmas" misleading would be an understatment. I'd go with, lie...Gary Moore is okay but that's not what I ordered...I'm going to return. I predict this DVD @50% off very soon...2nd Update: looks like I get screwed twice. I have to pay to return this DVD that was only ordered based on their deception...Had I ordered from a "Seller" vs. Amazon, the seller would have likely included a postage paid return, as I have had in the past. At least I would have had the opportunity to file a complaint. With Amazon's non-existent customer service, I have no opportunity to even complain/ ask for my postage...Lesson learned. At least it's only a few dollars...still BS though. You'd think the biggest online retailer, by far, would stand behind their products. They sure do charge more than the "Sellers"...3rd update: amazon has changed the ad for this DVD. Had I seen the current version/description, I wouldn't have bought it, especially w/ all the negative response. I decided not to return it as shipping costs(UPS is required method) would make this close to a break even, actually I'd never be made whole...so lesson learned.
Title: N/A

reviewText: i too was surprised when i bought this dvd set at a store and watched it. carol burnett does appear in some of it but is certainly not the main attraction. obviously with the "favorites" dvd set that came out recently that is actually from her show, someone decided her face would sell this dvd set. however, i am 54 yrs. old and i remember the garry moore show and always liked it as a small child. the christmas theme is treated very honestly and sweetly on these shows. and who doesn't love mahalia jackson putting her whole heart and soul into singing christmas carols and hymns?  how about julie andrews' very early rendition of "my favorite things?" the candid camera highlights with small children talking to santa "garry moore" claus are cute. i did not return my purchase to the store because even though carol is not the focus, there is still plenty to enjoy here for the price.

reviewText: THIS IS NOT THE CAROL BURNETT SHOW!!!  Possibly because the once famous Garry Moore is now mostly forgotten, Legendary Entertainment Alliance has decided to put Carol Burnett's name on this DVD title.THE GARRY MOORE SHOW CHRISTMAS SPECIALS! (All B&W; film Kinoscopes from video)Regular Cast: Carol Burnett, Marion Lorne (who played the clutzy Aunt Clara in Bewitched), Durwood Kirby (co-host of the original Candid Camera).1) Christmas 1959 - 55 minutesGuest Stars:Cliff Arquette as Charlie Weaver, Allen Funt, Eddie Hodges, Mahalia JacksonSkits:To Tell The TruthCandid Camera - with Allen Funt & Gary Moore as Santa ClauseBest Variety Program AwardCelebrity Christmas Cards2) Christmas 1960 - 58 minutesGuest Stars:Jonathan Winters as Grandpa Hopps, Louise O'Brian.Skits:At The Post Office, with Garry Moore impersonating BUSTER KEATON!That Wonderful YearDriving for the HolidaysCarolersCelebrity Christmas CardsGarry Moore wishes Red Skelton a speedy recovery as his Christmas wish.3) Christmas 1961 - EDITED to 43 minutesGuest Stars:Julie Andrews, Gwen VerdonSkits:That Wonderful YearLittle Drummer BoyYou Meet The Nicest PeopleJingle Bells in Spanish(Too bad this episode has about 10 minutes missing!)These shows are dated and will most likely be appreciated by those who originally watched them. Garry Moore refers to the second show on this DVD as their third Christmas show, so it appears that the first Christmas show (1958) is lost and accounts for why the show count decreased from 4 as originally announced to 3 as released.  The image quality is as good as a B&W; image filmed off of a TV screen (they way early live shows were recorded before videotape was commonly used).  The filmed Kinoscopes could have used a cleaning as dirt specks appear, heavy on a few occasions.To add to the misleading nature of Legendary Entertainment Alliance, the revised cover claims to include a lost episode from the first season of CANDID CAMERA!  This statement leads you to believe there is a CANDID CAMERA SHOW episode included here, THERE IS NOT. This reference is to a portion of that show being included as a skit in the 1959 Christmas show.The Bonus Features advertised on the back of the DVD case are NOT ON THE DVD, you have to go to their website and use the access code on a card inside the case to watch the Bonus Features.The Bonuses on the disc are merely viewing options allowing you to either watch all of Carol Burnett's segments (totaling just over an hour), or all of the music segments.Some classic commercials are included intact, like the 1961 Plymouth Cars, and Polaroid Cameras, but others have their product name blurred over and the audio bleeped.  The Cigarette commercials in the 1961 show are entirely removed.This would have been a ***** rating had it not been mis-represented by the manufacturer.Legendary Entertainment Alliance is brand new to the Home Video world, this is one of their first releases, and they had better learn fast not to deceive their customers as they will not return for more.  LEA should just let the shows sell themselves to the audience that will appreciate them.  Fans of The Carol Burnett Show will be disappointed in the misleading cover picture & title that led them to believe they were buying that show.----GARRY MOORE SHOW UPDATE----There is another Garry More Show coming to DVD, but it is also being disguised with another non-descript title of "FIRST PERFORMANCES"First Performances 1
summary: THE GARRY MOORE SHOW PRESENTS A CAROL BURNETT CHRISTMAS is the revised title of this DVD release.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When I bought this, Carol won in court to stop her old producer from using her name or image on the cover. This is really a Gary Moore Christmas show (3 of them) 1959-1961 and a whole lot of fun and enjoyment.  They have two extras, one of just the Christmas music and another one showing Carol which is about 90 minutes, but she only comes in about 30 minutes with walk-ons, etc.. This is a great buy if you want to see good clean entertainment.  There is also Gary Moore and the origninal Candid Camera segments which is a great buy, especially when they have the little ones caught on camera. Both great buys.  +JMJ+
Title: N/A

reviewText: The title, "A Carol Burnett Christmas" is misleading. A person (such as I) would assume that this would be the "Carol Burnett Show" Christmas episodes. Nope. One would also think that the subtitle "classic Christmas episodes starring Carol Burnett" would mean that the star of the show was Carol Burnett. Nope Nope.  This DVD is actually 3 black & white only episodes of "The Garry Moore Show" that actually starred Garry Moore; with Carol Burnett being a regular on the show, but NOT the star of the show. There is not one part of this show that even a great talent such as Carol Burnett could save.I am as sentimental as anyone but even I could not stomach the cheesy 1950-ish kitschy unfunny tripe presented in these shows.Do not be fooled by the full-color picture of Carol Burnett on the cover of the DVD--the one of Carol Burnett during the Carol Burnett Show years---as I said before these shows are poor quality black & white. And I repeat--this is NOT the "Carol Burnett Show".So disappointing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Unlike many others, I was never under the impression that this DVD was presenting episodes of Burnett's CBS variety show. The "Garry Moore" qualifier was there right from the start. However, I will condemn Legendary Entertainment for one of the most misleading and muddled releases of the year. It is easy to see understand why many buyers would be fooled.I purchased this DVD because I wanted "The Garry Moore Show", and this DVD delivers. What it doesn't deliver is the promised bonus feature of an episode of the rare CBS variety show "The Entertainers" which is touted as being on this disc. Also, the supposed "rare lost episode of Candid Camera" is an absolute falsehood as others here have noted. I have no idea why the third episode of "The Garry Moore Show" on this DVD is divided into 2 separate titles (not to mention that it is also edited with about 7 minutes of content missing). I suppose Legendary Entertainment's disc authoring prowess is about a second-rate as their marketing department.As for those complaining about the source material on this disc being kinescopes, you can thank the ever-thoughtless Bob Banner (producer)for this. He has a long history of discarding the master tapes of most of his variety shows of this era in favor keeping a cheap $10 kinescope as the only existing record of his productions.While I applaud Legendary Entertainment for tackling a release of Garry Moore's classic variety show, they certainly have a lot to learn about truth in advertising and the DVD buying public.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD features three episodes (1959, 1960, and 1961) of THE GARRY MOORE SHOW that featured Carol Burnett as a regular.  This is the first time that these episodes have been seen since they were originally broadcast on CBS.I remember Garry Moore (born and raised in Baltimore as Thomas Garrison Morfit) more as a game-show host and panelist (I'VE GOT A SECRET, TO TELL THE TRUTH), than as a variety-show MC.  These shows are very entertaining, and Carol's skits are funny.  The guest stars, including Mahalia Jackson, Julie Andrews, and Gwen Verdon, really stand out.  The quality of the kinescopes are good for their age, and all of the commercials are performed by Garry and the cast members within the context of the show.  Some of the advertisers' names (e.g., Kellogg's Corn Flakes) are masked out for legal reasons; if it was not possible to get legal clearances for these ads, they probably should have been removed.  The commercials, the Christmas songs, and Carol's sketches can also be enjoyed by themselves as bonus features.  The CANDID CAMERA sketch referenced on the packaging is a promo for the next episode that is featured in THE GARRY MOORE SHOW itself, not a full episode.  Durward Kirby, the host of CANDID CAMERA, was a regular on the Moore show.  Also, the Christmas episode of Carol Burnett's series THE ENTERTAINERS does not appear on this set.I could be wrong, but I don't think there was ever a Christmas episode of THE CAROL BURNETT SHOW, which probably explains why this DVD was released instead.This disc is good though, particularly if you like Garry Moore.
summary: It's not Carol's own show, but it is entertaining
Title: N/A

reviewText: I came to Amazon ready to purchase this DVD, but I'm glad I read the reviews first.YES, the packaging is misleading, in at least two different ways: The 1970s color photo of Carol, when there are NO 1970s color Carol Burnett Shows here, and suggesting that there's a complete episode of Candid Camera, which there isn't - only a segment.This STILL might've been an OK DVD, because I like vintage TV, and have seen very little of The Garry Moore Show.But once I read in other reviews that the vintage commercials and sponsor products were left in place (which is always cool), BUT with the products BLURRED AND PIXELATED (which is NOT COOL!), I decided I would spend my money on something else.More and more video companies are frightened by the slim possibility that they will be sued for song royalties and using product logos without permission. It really is getting ridiculous.
summary: A mess! (But it could've still been OK.)
